channel.title: Xubuntu
channel.description:
I just recently installed Xunbuntu 12.04 using a flash drive; however, I cannot send anything to the trashcan and I get this message in return: Unable to find or delete trash directory.
Anyone know how to fix this?

item.title: Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

This is a bug

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/glib2.0/+bug/192629

There is no solution as of yet, the work around is to add an entry in /etc/fstab

You can do this with ntfs-config, a graphical tool, or the command line.
ntfs-config

[code]sudo apt-get install ntfs-config

gksu ntfs-config
[/code]

You then change the ownership and prmissions of the ntfs partition.

command line
Edit/etc/fstab

[code]# command line
sudo -e /etc/fstab

graphical

gksu gedit /etc/fstab[/code]

Add a line for your ntfs partition. If you use the permissions option you can then set permissions on ntfs partitions.

Once you have the correct permissions,

cd /media/your_mount_point mkdir .Trash-1000

Change “.Trash-1000” you your UID (first user is 1000, use the command id to show yours)
